Entries.preloader.requirements-failed.title: System Warning
Entries.preloader.requirements-failed.no-compute: Your GPU ('<gpu-name/>') does not support compute shaders. Please ensure your system meets the minimum system requirements. You can also try updating your graphics drivers.
Entries.preloader.requirements-failed.not-enough: Your GPU ('<gpu-name/>') does not have enough VRAM (<gpu-vram/> MB). <required-vram/> MB VRAM is required at least. Please ensure your system meets the minimum system requirements.
Your System does not have enough memory (<memory/> MB). <required-memory/> MB Memory is required at least. Please ensure your system meets the minimum system requirements.
Entries.preloader.requirements-failed.bad-os-win: Your operating system version (<os-version/>) is not supported. Please ensure your system meets the minimum system requirements (Windows <minimum-os-version/> or newer).

Entries.preload.telemetry.title: Privacy
Entries.preload.telemetry.description:
To improve the game, we would like to collect anonymized statistics and data about balancing, playtime, level completion time, crashes, performance & system statistics, settings, and achievements. 

This also involves using a third-party service called "Unity Analytics".

All data is sent anonymously and cannot be traced back to you.

If you are interested in the details, you can also check our <link:privacy-policy>Privacy Policy</link>.

Entries.menu.modeconfig.seed.description: The same seed in combination with the same map generation options will always generate exactly the same map, which means you can also share it with others.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.research-multiplier.desc: Controls the amount of shapes you need to deliver to complete milestones and side tasks.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.chunk-limit-multiplier.d: There is a limit to the amount of platforms you can build, which can be increased by research. You can adjust the limit increase here, and also disable it entirely.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.blueprint-cost-multiplie: Copy/pasting costs blueprint points, which you gain by delivering specific shapes. Control the amount of blueprint points required here. You can also disable the cost entirely.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.difficulty-preset.descri: Controls the amount of shapes required, costs of copy/paste and how many platforms you can build.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.difficulty-preset.detail:

Platform Limit: <gl><platform-limit/></gl>

Entries.menu.modeconfig.difficulty-preset.hint-p: Starting without an <gl>Operator Certification</gl> is not recommended.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.scenario-preset.descript: Determines the progression of the game, which shapes are required & generated on the map and much more.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.mapgen.preview.toggle-vi: You can disable the preview to avoid spoiling yourself.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.mapgen.fluids.spawn-prim: Whether primary colors (usually red, green, blue) are spawned on the map.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.mapgen.fluids.spawn-seco: Whether secondary colors (usually yellow, magenta, cyan) are spawned on the map.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.mapgen.fluids.spawn-tert: Whether tertiary colors (usually white) are spawned on the map.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shared.patch-like: Chance of a patch to spawn in a sector. A chance higher than 100% means that more than one patch can spawn, for example 120% means guaranteed one patch and 20% chance for a second.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shared.patch-base: The size of a patch in the same sector as the vortex.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shared.patch-size: How much (in percent) the patch grows with every sector distance to the vortex.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shared.patch-max-: The maximum size of a patch.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shapes.shape-colo: How likely it is that all parts of a shape are colored. Doesn't affect uncolored shape generation.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shapes.rare-shape: How likely rare shapes (usually 'Stars') are spawned compared to common shapes.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shapes.very-rare-: How likely very rare shapes (usually 'Diamond') are spawned compared to common shapes.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.shapegen.title: Shape Generation
Entries.menu.modeconfig.shapegen.likeliness.desc: The chance that a shape of this type will be selected when generating a patch.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.shapegen.min-distance-to: Minimum sector distance to the vortex from which this shape type can spawn.
Entries.menu.modeconfig.shapegen.examples.descri: Examples of shapes of this type that could spawn.

Entries.shape-viewer.title: Shape Viewer
Entries.shape-viewer.short-code.tooltip-descript: Every shape can be described via a unique code. For every part, there is an uppercase letter for the shape type and one for the color. Layers are separated by ':', and empty parts are indicated by '--'. Part Codes C: Circle R: Rectangle W: Diamond S: Star P: Pin (no color) c: Crystal Color Codes u: No color r: Red g: Green b: Blue c: Cyan m: Magenta y: Yellow w: White Examples CuCuCuCu: Uncolored circle RbRb----: Half blue rectangle

Entries.building.CrystalGeneratorBuilding.title: Crystal Generator
Entries.building-variant.CrystalGeneratorDefault: Fills <gl>Gaps</gl> and <gl>Pins</gl> of a shape with fluid & and hardens it into <gl>Crystal</gl>.
Entries.building.FluidStorageBuilding.title: Fluid Tank
Entries.building-variant.SandboxItemProducerDefa: Produces an <gl>Infinite Amount</gl> of a given shape.
Entries.building-variant.SandboxFluidProducerDef: Produces an <gl>Infinite Amount</gl> of a given fluid.
Entries.building.LabelBuilding.title: Label
Entries.building.WireBuilding.title: Wire
Entries.building-variant.WireBridgeVariant.title: Wire Bridge
Entries.building-variant.WireBridgeVariant.descr: Allows you to <gl>Cross</gl> two wires without them intersecting.
Entries.building-variant.WireTransmitterSenderVa: Allows to <gl>Exchange</gl> logical signals between space platforms.
Entries.building.WireDisplayBuilding.title: Display
Entries.building-variant.BeltReaderDefaultVarian: Detects and displays the <gl>Speed</gl> and <gl>Contents</gl> of a belt.
Entries.building.WireButtonBuilding.title: Button
Entries.building.LogicGateBuilding.title: Logic Gates
Entries.building-variant.LogicGateXOrVariant.des: Activates if exactly <gl>One</gl> input is on.
Entries.building-variant.LogicGateCompareVariant: Activates if both inputs match the configured <gl>Comparison</gl>.
Entries.building-variant.LogicGateIfVariant.desc: Forwards the input signal if the <gl>Trigger Signal</gl> on the top is on.
Entries.building.VirtualProcessorBuilding.title: Simulated Buildings
Entries.building-variant.VirtualHalfCutterDefaul: Simulates <gl>Destroying</gl> the <gl>West Half</gl> of a shape.
Entries.building-variant.VirtualUnstackerDefault:
Simulates <gl>Separating</gl> the <gl>Top Layer</gl> of a shape.

Does not break crystals.
Entries.building-variant.VirtualStackerDefaultVa: Simulates <gl>Stacking</gl> one a shape on top of another.
Entries.building-variant.VirtualPainterDefaultVa: Simulates <gl>Painting</gl> the <gl>Top Layer</gl> of a shape.
Entries.building-variant.VirtualHalvesSwapperDef: Simulates swapping the <gl>West Halves</gl> of two shapes.
Entries.building-variant.VirtualAnalyzerDefaultV: Outputs the <gl>Shape Type</gl> and <gl>Color</gl> of the <gl>North-East</gl> first layer quarter.
Entries.research.RNInitial.title: Rotate & Cut
Entries.research.RNInitial.description: The <gl>Vortex</gl> was kind enough to provide you with the basics to <gl>Extract</gl>, <gl>Cut</gl> and <gl>Rotate</gl> shapes.
Entries.research.RNStackerLayer2.title: Stacker & 2nd Floor
Entries.research.RNStackerLayer2.description: You were rewarded the <gl>Stacker</gl> and <gl>2nd Floor</gl>, allowing you to <gl>Stack Shapes</gl> and build <gl>Multi-Layer</gl> factories. Let's see what you can do with them!
Entries.research.RNBlueprints.title: Blueprints
Entries.research.RNBlueprints.description: We thought you might need this - You can now <gl>Copy</gl> and <gl>Paste</gl> parts of your factory. But not the messy ones, please!
Entries.research.RNIslandBuilding.title: Space Platforms
Entries.research.RNIslandBuilding.description:
You've proven some basic skills, so we think you are ready for this. You may now build <gl>Space Platforms</gl> and <gl>Foundations</gl> to expand in the universe.

For these ones though, we've added a <gl>Platform Limit</gl>. I mean, we are not insane, right?
Entries.research.RNFluids.title: Fluids & Painting
Entries.research.RNFluids.description:
Alright, let's break up with these boring gray shapes. You can now extract <gl>Fluids</gl> and <gl>Paint</gl> shapes. 

But do us a favor and don't spill anything on the floor, they stick really well.
Entries.research.RNTrains.title: Trains
Entries.research.RNTrains.description: We know you've been waiting for these. <gl>Huge Amounts</gl> of shapes over <gl>Long Distances</gl> - the dream of every operator!
Entries.research.RNPinPusher.title: Pin Pusher
Entries.research.RNPinPusher.description: <gl>Pushes</gl> a shape up and creates a <gl>Support Pin</gl> below every non-empty quarter on the first layer.
Entries.research.RNColorMixing.title: Color Mixing
Entries.research.RNColorMixing.description: Let's have some more fun with colors! With the <gl>Color Mixer</gl> you can mix any two colors to create <gl>Secondary</gl> and <gl>Tertiary</gl> colors.
Entries.research.RNCrystals.title: Crystals
Entries.research.RNCrystals.description:
Alright, let's spice things up a bit with <gl>Crystals</gl>! Fill fluid into empty <gl>Gaps</gl> or <gl>Pins</gl> of a shape and harden it with the <gl>Crystal Generator</gl>.

We tried our best, but they still seem a little fragile - so better don't <gl>Cut</gl> through or <gl>Stack</gl> them.
Entries.research.RNEndOfGame.title: Final Qualification
Entries.research.RNEndOfGame.description: Congratulations, operator, you <gl>Passed</gl> the final qualification!
Entries.research.RNWireBasics.title: Wire Basics
Entries.research.RNWireBasics.description: Unlocks <gl>Wires</gl>, <gl>Signals</gl>, <gl>Filters</gl>, <gl>Readers</gl>, <gl>Displays</gl> and <gl>Buttons</gl> to automate your factory even more!
Entries.research.RNWireLogicGates.title: Logic Gates
Entries.research.RNWireLogicGates.description: Unlocks <gl>And</gl>, <gl>Or</gl>, <gl>Not</gl>, <gl>Xor</gl>, <gl>Transistors</gl> and the <gl>Comparator</gl> to perform boolean logic with signals.
Entries.research.RNWireVirtualProcessing.title: Simulated Buildings
Entries.research.RNWireVirtualProcessing.descrip: Allows you to <gl>Simulate</gl> the <gl>Cutting</gl>, <gl>Stacking</gl>, <gl>Unstacking</gl> and <gl>Painting</gl> of logical shape signals.
Entries.research.RNWireTransmission.title: Global Wire Transmission
Entries.research.RNWireTransmission.description: Unlocks <gl>Global Wire Transmitters</gl>, allowing you to send signals wireless over different channels and reading the <gl>Operator Shapes</gl>. Requires 3rd Floor.
Entries.research.RNFluidMinerExtension.title: Fluid Miner Extensions
Entries.research.RNFluidMinerExtension.descripti: Allows you to connect <gl>Extensions</gl> to the <gl>Fluid Miner</gl> to increase its throughput.
Entries.research.RNTrainsGreen.title: Trains - Green
Entries.research.RNTrainsGreen.description: Allows you build <gl>Green</gl> trains & rails for more routing options.
Entries.research.RNTrainsBlue.title: Trains - Blue
Entries.research.RNTrainsBlue.description: Allows you build <gl>Blue</gl> trains & rails for more routing options.
Entries.research.RNTrainsWhite.title: Trains - White
Entries.research.RNTrainsWhite.description: Allows you build <gl>White</gl> trains & rails for more routing options.
Entries.research.RNTrainsFillerWagon.title: Trains - Filler Wagon
Entries.research.RNTrainsFillerWagon.description: Allows you build <gl>Filler Wagons</gl>, which can be used to space-out other wagons.
Entries.research.RNTrainHubDelivery.title: Train Vortex Delivery
Entries.research.RNTrainHubDelivery.description: Allows you to <gl>Launch Trains</gl> into the <gl>Vortex</gl> to deliver shapes!
Entries.research.RNTrainsFluidWagons.title: Trains - Fluid Wagon
Entries.research.RNTrainsFluidWagons.description: Unlocks <gl>Fluid Wagons</gl>, allowing you to transport fluids via trains.
Entries.research.RNRailRollerCoasterDLCContent.d: Unlocks the purely cosmetic <gl>Rail Loop</gl> and <gl>Rail Twister</gl>.
Entries.research.RNSandboxTools.title: Sandbox Tools
Entries.research.RNSandboxTools.description: Unlocks Sandbox Tools, allowing you to create any shape or fluid on the fly. Can only be unlocked via cheats.
Entries.research.RNLayer3.title: 3rd Floor
Entries.research.RNLayer3.description: Unlocks the <gl>3rd Floor</gl>, allowing you to build on even more layers!
Entries.research.RNHubSize.title: More Vortex Inputs
Entries.research.RNHubSize.description: Increases the <gl>Size</gl> of the <gl>Vortex</gl> to allow for more inputs.
Entries.research.RNIslandLayouts1.title: Foundations I
Entries.research.RNIslandLayouts2.title: Foundations II
Entries.research.RNIslandLayouts3.title: Foundations III
Entries.research.RNIslandLayouts4.title: Foundations IV

Entries.research.RULayer2.title: 2nd Floor
Entries.research.RULayer2.description: Unlocks the <gl>2nd Floor</gl>, enabling you to build multidimensional factories.
Entries.research.RULayer3.title: 3rd Floor
Entries.research.RULayer3.description: Unlocks the <gl>3rd Floor</gl>, enabling you to build even more compact factories.
Entries.research.RUBlueprints.title: Blueprints
Entries.research.RUBlueprints.description: Allows you to copy and paste parts of your factories.
Entries.research.RUIslandPlacement.title: Space Platforms
Entries.research.RUIslandPlacement.description: Allows you to expand into the space by placing new platforms.
Entries.research.RUPlayerLevel.title: Operator Level
Entries.research.RUPlayerLevel.description: Keep delivering past milestone shapes to increase your <gl>Operator Level</gl>, granting you rewards from the vortex.
Entries.research.RURailManagement.title: Trains
Entries.research.RURailManagement.description: Allows you to transport huge amounts of resources over long distances.
Entries.research.RUFluids.title: Fluids
Entries.research.RUFluids.description: Allows you to extract and transport fluids. Shapes can be painted with fluids.
Entries.research.RUWires.title: Wires
Entries.research.RUWires.description: Allows you to dynamically control your factories with wires.
Entries.research.RUTrainHubDelivery.title: Train Vortex Delivery
Entries.research.RUTrainHubDelivery.description: Allows you to <gl>Launch Trains</gl> into the <gl>Vortex</gl> to deliver shapes!

Entries.island-layout.Layout_SpaceBeltNode.title: <copy-from:island-layout.SpaceBeltPathPlacement.title/>
Entries.island-layout.Layout_SpaceBeltTunnel_Ent: Transports shapes <gl>Below</gl> other platforms. Only works in a <gl>Straight Path</gl>.

Entries.island-layout.Layout_SpacePipeTunnel_Ent: Transports fluids <gl>Below</gl> other platforms. Only works in a <gl>Straight Path</gl>.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_ShapeMiner.title: Shape Miner
Entries.island-layout.Layout_ShapeMiner.descript:
Extracts <gl>Shapes</gl> from <gl>Asteroids</gl>.

Connect up to 3 additional <gl>Extensions</gl> to increase the throughput.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_ShapeMinerExtension: Increases the throughput of a <gl>Shape Miner</gl>.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_FluidMiner.title: Fluid Miner
Entries.island-layout.Layout_FluidMiner.descript:
Extracts <gl>Fluids</gl> from <gl>Fluid Deposits</gl>.

Connect up to 3 additional <gl>Extensions</gl> to increase the throughput.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_FluidMinerExtension: Increases the throughput of a <gl>Fluid Miner</gl>.

Entries.island-layout.Layout_Normal_4_2x2.title: <copy-from:island-layout.Layout_GenericPlatform.title/>

Entries.island-layout.Layout_Normal_9_3x3.title: <copy-from:island-layout.Layout_GenericPlatform.title/>
Entries.island-layout.Layout_RailNode.title: Rail
Entries.island-layout.Layout_RailNode.descriptio:
Allows <gl>Trains</gl> to move with high speed.

Multiple <gl>Train Colors</gl> can share one rail.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_RailPath.title: <copy-from:island-layout.Layout_RailNode.title/>
Entries.island-layout.Layout_TrainLauncher.title: Train Launcher
Entries.island-layout.Layout_TrainLauncher.descr: <gl>Launches</gl> trains across <gl>Platforms</gl> or into the <gl>Vortex</gl> with variable range.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_TrainCatcher.title: Train Catcher
Entries.island-layout.Layout_RailPath_Red.title: Red Rail Configurator
Entries.island-layout.Layout_RailPath_Red.descri: Drag over a <gl>Rail Intersection</gl> to change which direction <gl>Red</gl> trains will take.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_RailPath_Blue.title: Blue Rail Configurator
Entries.island-layout.Layout_RailPath_Blue.descr: Drag over a <gl>Rail Intersection</gl> to change which direction <gl>Blue</gl> trains will take.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_RailPath_Green.desc: Drag over a <gl>Rail Intersection</gl> to change which direction <gl>Green</gl> trains will take.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_RailPath_White.desc: Drag over a <gl>Rail Intersection</gl> to change which direction <gl>White</gl> trains will take.
Accumulates <gl>Shapes</gl> into <gl>Fixed Size Packages</gl>, buffers them and loads them on <gl>Shape Wagons</gl>.
Accumulates <gl>Fluids</gl> into <gl>Fixed Size Packages</gl>, buffers them and loads them on <gl>Fluid Wagons</gl>.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_TrainStation.title: Train Stop
Entries.island-layout.Layout_TrainStation.descri: Signals trains to <gl>Stop</gl> so you can <gl>Load</gl> or <gl>Unload</gl> them.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_TrainShapeWagonExte: Place behind a <gl>Locomotive</gl> to add a <gl>Shape Wagon</gl> to the train.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_TrainFluidWagonExte: Place behind a <gl>Locomotive</gl> to add a <gl>Fluid Wagon</gl> to the train.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_TrainFillerWagonExt: Place behind a <gl>Locomotive</gl> to add a <gl>Filler Wagon</gl> to the train.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_TrainProducer_Red.d: Provides one <gl>Locomotive</gl>. Add <gl>Wagons</gl> to expand the train.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_TrainTwister.title: Rail Twister
Entries.island-layout.Layout_TrainTwister.descri:
Decorative only, makes trains <gl>Twist</gl> 360 degrees.

Part of the <gl>Supporter Edition</gl>.
Entries.island-layout.Layout_TrainRollerCoasterL:
Decorative only, makes trains move in a <gl>Loop</gl>.

Part of the <gl>Supporter Edition</gl>.
Entries.keybinding.main.toggle-research.descript: Open the last opened tab within the <gl>Research Interface</gl>.
Entries.keybinding.main.toggle-research-levels.d: Open the <gl>Milestone</gl> tab of the research interface.
Entries.keybinding.main.toggle-research-shop.des: Open the <gl>Upgrades</gl> tab of the research interface.
Entries.keybinding.main.toggle-research-side-que: Open the <gl>Tasks</gl> tab of the research interface.
Entries.keybinding.main.toggle-research-player-l: Open the <gl>Operator Level</gl> tab of the research interface.
Entries.keybinding.main.toggle-pause.description: Pause or resume the game, this usually is not necessary, but included for convenience.
Entries.keybinding.main.toggle-ui.description: Toggles the interface, useful for creating screenshots.
Entries.keybinding.main.scope-change.description: Toggle between <gl>Platform</gl> and <gl>Building</gl> mode. This also automatically happens while zooming.
Entries.keybinding.main.undo.description: <gl>Revert</gl> your last operation. Almost everything can be reverted, but there is a limit of 100 operations.
Entries.keybinding.main.redo.description: Redo an operation you previously used undo for.
Entries.keybinding.main.screenshot.description: Take a screenshot. The screenshot will be saved to your user folder.
Entries.keybinding.camera.rotate-cw.description: Rotate the camera clockwise. The amount depends on your <gl>Camera Snapping</gl> setting.
Entries.keybinding.camera.rotate-ccw.description: Rotate the camera counter-clockwise. The amount depends on your <gl>Camera Snapping</gl> setting.
Entries.keybinding.camera.move-right.description: Hold to move the camera to the right.
Entries.keybinding.camera.move-left.description: Hold to move the camera to the left.
Entries.keybinding.camera.move-up.description: Hold to move the camera to the top.
Entries.keybinding.camera.move-down.description: Hold to move the camera to the bottom.
Entries.keybinding.camera.move-faster.descriptio: Hold while using the 'Move left/right/up/down' buttons to move faster.
Entries.keybinding.camera.mouse-drag-modifier.de: Hold and drag to move the camera.
Entries.keybinding.camera.angle-drag-modifier.de: Hold and move the mouse to change the camera angle. Moving left/right changes the rotation, and up/down changes the angle.
Entries.keybinding.camera.select-layer-up.descri: Move one floor up. Use <gl>While Dragging</gl> belts to place a <gl>Conveyor Lift</gl>.
Entries.keybinding.camera.select-layer-down.desc: Move one floor down. Use <gl>While Dragging</gl> belts to place a <gl>Conveyor Lift</gl>.
Entries.keybinding.camera.toggle-show-all-layers: Toggles the visibility of structures <gl>Above</gl> the current floor.
Entries.keybinding.camera.zoom-in.description: You can bind this a key to allow zooming the camera without a scroll wheel.
Entries.keybinding.camera.angle-up.description: You can bind this a key to allow changing the camera angle without using a middle mouse button.
Entries.keybinding.toolbar.next-toolbar-slot.des: Switch to the next toolbar slot.
Entries.keybinding.toolbar.previous-toolbar-slot: Switch to the previous toolbar slot.
Entries.keybinding.toolbar.next-toolbar.descript: Switch to the next toolbar category.
Entries.keybinding.toolbar.previous-toolbar.desc: Switch to the previous toolbar category.
Entries.keybinding.toolbar.next-variant.descript: Switch to the next unlocked variant during placement (i.e. to toggle between rotator variants).
Entries.keybinding.toolbar.previous-variant.desc: Switch to the previous unlocked variant during placement (i.e. to toggle between Rotator variants).
Rotates the current structure clockwise by 90 degrees.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.rotate-ccw: Rotates the current structure counter-clockwise by 90 degrees.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.mirror.des: Mirrors the current building, platform or blueprint.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.mirror-inv: Mirrors the current building, platform or blueprint on the other side.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.switch-pat: While placing belts, use this hotkey to switch the corner a belt uses.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.place-chec: Anchors a path, allowing you to drag it in any direction without changing anything before that point. Highly recommended to use since it makes placement much easier.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.rotate-bui: Rotate a structure during placement so it faces to the right.
Rotate a structure during placement so it faces to the left.
Rotate a structure during placement so it faces to the top.
Rotate a structure during placement so it faces to the bottom.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.transform-: Move the structure to a higher floor without changing the current floor. Useful for quickly moving blueprints.
Move the structure to a lower floor without changing the current floor. Useful for quickly moving blueprints.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.blueprint-: Hold this modifier key during placement to allow overriding existing structures.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.save-bluep: Saves the selection as a <gl>Blueprint</gl> in your <gl>Blueprint Library</gl>.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.select-base.de: The base button for all selection commands. While holding & dragging, use either <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> or <hotkey:mass-selection.deselect-area-modifier/>.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.select-single-: Click or select individual structures to add or remove them to the selection.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.select-area-mo: Hold this modifier key and drag with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-base/> to select one or multiple structures.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.deselect-area-: Hold this modifier key and drag with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-base/> to reduce your current selection.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.delete.descrip: Destroys all structures in the current selection.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.select-all-of-: Hold this key while clicking a structure icon in the details panel of a selection to change the selection to include only this type of structure.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.quick-delete-d: Hold and drag to delete structures. You can hold <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> to delete an entire area.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.pipette.descri: Clone the structure below the mouse cursor so you can place more copies.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.make-blueprint: Create a placeable copy of the current selection.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.paste-blueprin: Paste a blueprint from the system clipboard.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.select-connect: Selects all connected structures of the current selection.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.clear-selectio: Clears all items and fluids within the selected structures.
Cuts the current selection so it can be placed elsewhere.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.browse-bluepri: Hold this key while using your scroll wheel <hotkey:camera.angle-drag-modifier/> to browse through past blueprints.
Entries.keybinding.waypoints.create-new.descript: Create new <gl>Marker</gl> at the current camera position & orientation.
Entries.keybinding.waypoints.jump-back.descripti: After jumping to a marker or the vortex platform, use this to jump back to your previous location.
Entries.keybinding.waypoints.edit-below-cursor.d: Hover a marker on the side and use this hotkey to edit it.
Entries.keybinding.debug.debug-console-autocompl: Try to auto-complete the current command input.
Entries.keybinding.debug.debug-console-select-pr: Go back to the previous command(s) issued.
Entries.keybinding.debug.debug-console-select-ne: Go forward to the next command(s) issued.
Entries.keybinding.debug.generic.description: Execute a command that was stored with 'console.bind-hotkey' previously.
Entries.keybinding.debug.fast-speed.description: For debugging purposes only. This is NOT a fast forward toggle and will cause your factories to run at less precision!
Entries.setting.language.description: Choose your preferred language for the game.
Entries.setting.savegame-backup-count.descriptio: The game automatically deletes old backups, but keeps a set of recent backups, as well as every 50th backup. Control here how many backups to keep at least.
Entries.setting.autosave-interval.description: The game saves a backup of the savegame every once in a while. You can control the interval here.
Entries.setting.telemetry.description: Whether to send anonymized analytics to help improving the game.
Entries.setting.tutorial.description: Highly recommended, enables the tutorial & general tips to succeed in the game.
Entries.setting.color-visualization-scheme.descr: Determines the color mixing scheme used by the game. This is purely visual and can be changed any time.
Entries.setting.ui-scale.description: Controls the size of the user interface.
Entries.setting.copy-bp-to-clipboard.description: When enabled, automatically copies any blueprint to your system clipboard so you can share it or paste it again with <hotkey:mass-selection.paste-blueprint/>.
Entries.setting.menu-transitions.description: You can disable the menu animations if you experience motion sickness.
Entries.setting.show-keybinding-hints.descriptio: Whether to show recommended hotkeys above the building toolbar.
Entries.setting.toolbar-duplicate-selection-mode: Choose what happens if you press a toolbar hotkey again. For example, assuming you pressed <hotkey:toolbar.select-slot-0/> to select a conveyor belt. Now you press <hotkey:toolbar.select-slot-0/> again - with <gl>Deselect</gl>, the belt gets deselected, with <gl>Cycle Slots</gl> you now cycle to the belt launcher variant.
Entries.setting.viewport-snapping.description: Snaps the camera while rotating to increments, i.e. with 90 degrees snapping the camera automatically snaps to either North, East, South or West.
Entries.setting.keyboard-camera-speed.descriptio: Controls how fast the camera moves when you move it with the keyboard.
Controls how fast the camera rotates when you drag with the mouse to the left/right.
Controls how fast the camera rotates when you drag with the mouse to the top/bottom.
Entries.setting.mouse-border-pan.description: If enabled, the camera automatically moves when you move your mouse cursor to the screen borders.
Entries.setting.confine-mouse-cursor.description: If enabled, prevents your cursor from leaving the window while playing. Does not work on all platforms.
Entries.setting.mouse-border-pan-speed.descripti: Controls the speed of the screen panning.
Entries.setting.invert-zoom.description: If enabled, inverts the direction the camera zooms when you use the scroll wheel.
Entries.setting.zoom-sensitivity.description: Controls how fast the camera zooms in/out when you use the scroll wheel.
Entries.setting.window-mode.description: <gl>Fullscreen</gl> is the most performant and recommended option, but will cause a delay when switching back to your desktop.
Entries.setting.target-display.description: The target display for the game window to exist within.
Entries.setting.resolution.description: The window resolution. Recommended to set to the same as your monitor resolution.
Entries.setting.vsync.description: Sync the maximum frame rate to your monitor refresh rate. Highly recommended. You can also sync it to half your refresh rate with 2nd VBlank for example.
Entries.setting.fps-limit.description: Limits the maximum frames per second, but might introduce stuttering. Using VSync instead is highly recommended!
Entries.setting.reduce-input-latency.description: Reduces input latency by preventing additional frames to be queued whilst the GPU is busy. This increases CPU load and can cause a lower framerate as a result!
Entries.setting.antialiasing.description: Decreases artifacts at the edges of objects. MSAA is very performance intensive, and SMAA is very cheap. If you are playing on 4k, SMAA is highly recommended.
Entries.setting.ambient-occlusion.description:
Increases the visual quality using screen space ambient occlusion. Can be very performance intensive on low-end setups.

<copy-from:setting.performance-impact-high/>
Entries.setting.shadow-quality.description:
Controls the resolution and quality of the shadows. Higher quality shadows require more GPU memory.

<copy-from:setting.performance-impact-high/>
Entries.setting.shader-quality.description:
Controls the shader & effect quality. On lower values, disables effects that are not relevant for gameplay.

<copy-from:setting.performance-impact-high/>
Entries.setting.background-details.description:
Controls the amount of details and decorations for the space background.

<copy-from:setting.performance-impact-moderate/>
Entries.setting.island-details.description:
Controls the details of the space platforms, lower values use less detailed meshes at the cost of visual quality.

<copy-from:setting.performance-impact-moderate/>
Entries.setting.building-details.description:
Controls the details of the buildings, lower values use less detailed meshes and animations at the cost of visual quality.

<copy-from:setting.performance-impact-moderate/>
Entries.setting.chromatic-aberration.description:
Adds separation of color channels near the edges of the screen.

<copy-from:setting.performance-impact-none/>
Entries.setting.vignette.description:
Darkens the edges of the screen.

<copy-from:setting.performance-impact-none/>
Entries.setting.anisotropic-filtering.descriptio:
Increases texture quality at steep angles, especially on the floor grid texture.

<copy-from:setting.performance-impact-low/>
Entries.setting.post-processing.description:
Enables color grading, vignette and outline.

<copy-from:setting.performance-impact-none/>
Entries.setting.interface-effects.description:
Enables effects on the user interface.

<copy-from:setting.performance-impact-none/>
Entries.setting.master-volume.description: The overall game volume, including music and sound effects.
Entries.setting.music-volume.description: The volume of the music tracks.
Entries.setting.sfx-volume.description: The general volume of all sound effects.
Entries.setting.buildings-volume.description: Volume of the sounds from individual buildings, when zooming in close.
Entries.setting.ui-volume.description: Volume of interface sound effects, i.e. buttons & notifications.
Entries.setting.ambience-volume.description: Volume of the space ambience or conveyor belt ambience.
Entries.setting.mute-in-background.description: If enabled, the game will be muted while the window is not focused.
Entries.setting.simulation-mode.description: For internal testing only. Controls how the simulation is processed.
Entries.setting.editor-start-in-mode.description: For internal testing only. Controls what mode the editor starts when there is no existing savegame.
Entries.setting.unlock-dlcs.description: For internal testing only. Whether to pretend all DLCs are unlocked.
Entries.setting.start-fresh-in-editor.descriptio: For internal testing only. Whether to always start a fresh savegame in the editor, even if there is a savegame already.
Entries.setting.test-tutorial-hints.description: For internal testing only. Shows tutorial hints much more quickly, and also shows hidden tutorial steps in the knowledge panel.
Entries.setting.trailer-mode.description: For internal testing only. Used for trailer capturing.
Entries.setting.start-game-paused.description: For internal testing only. Start the editor in paused mode.

Entries.wiki.fully-locked-entry: You have not unlocked this mechanic yet.

Entries.wiki.WKWelcome.title: Welcome to your Certification!
Entries.wiki.WKWelcome.text-intro-1:
Thank you for signing up! You did sign up, right ..?

Either way .. the <gl>Vortex</gl> requires us to evaluate your <gl>Factory Operator</gl> skills before issuing your <gl>Operator Certification</gl>. 

Simply deliver the requested <gl>Shapes</gl> as efficient as possible. That's it!

We might reward you with new <gl>Upgrades</gl> and <gl>Technologies</gl> based on your performance..
Entries.wiki.WKWelcome.text-intro-3: Ah, and you can have as many <gl>Buildings</gl> as you want. But please don't damage them - we still need them for the next participant.
Entries.wiki.WKShapes.title: Shapes
Entries.wiki.WKShapes.text-shapes-1: <gl>Shapes</gl> are composed of smaller sections, named <gl>Quarters</gl>, that can be separated and reorganized.
Entries.wiki.WKShapes.text-shapes-2: Similar to cakes, shapes can have multiple <gl>Layers</gl>, each with up to 4 distinct quarters. Different types of quarters can be found by expanding deeper into space.
Entries.wiki.WKShapes.text-shape-viewer-1: You can inspect shapes in the <gl>Shape Viewer</gl> by clicking <hotkey:building-placement.confirm-placement/> any shape in the <gl>User Interface</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKCameraControls.title: Camera Navigation
Entries.wiki.WKCameraControls.text-camera-move: Use <hotkey:camera.move-up/>, <hotkey:camera.move-left/>, <hotkey:camera.move-down/>, <hotkey:camera.move-right/> to move the camera. You can also use <hotkey:camera.mouse-drag-modifier/>, but it does not work while building.
Entries.wiki.WKCameraControls.text-camera-rotate: To rotate the camera, hold <hotkey:camera.angle-drag-modifier/> and move the mouse horizontally to change the direction, and vertically to change the perspective.
Entries.wiki.WKCameraControls.text-camera-snap-1: The camera automatically <gl>Snaps</gl> to multiples of 30 degrees by default. You can change this by clicking the magnet icon in the bottom left corner of the screen.
Entries.wiki.WKCameraControls.text-camera-snap-2: For example, with 90 degrees snapping the camera automatically snaps to either North, East, South or West.
Entries.wiki.WKCameraControls.text-jumpvortex-1: If you ever get lost, you can click the Home Icon or press to jump back to the Vortex Platform.
Entries.wiki.WKBasicControls.title: Basic Controls
Entries.wiki.WKBasicControls.text-placement-2: You can <gl>Rotate</gl> any structure with <hotkey:building-placement.rotate-cw/> and <hotkey:building-placement.rotate-ccw/>.
Entries.wiki.WKBasicControls.text-deletion-2: To delete an entire <gl>Area</gl>, drag with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> + <hotkey:mass-selection.quick-delete-drag/>.
Entries.wiki.WKBasicControls.text-pipette-1: Move the cursor over a building or platform and press <hotkey:mass-selection.pipette/> to quickly select it in the toolbar.
Entries.wiki.WKBasicControls.text-mirroring-1: Buildings, Platforms and Blueprints can be <gl>Mirrored</gl> with <hotkey:building-placement.mirror/>. Use <hotkey:building-placement.mirror-inverse/> to mirror on the other axis.
Entries.wiki.WKBasicControls.text-floor-visibili: Press <hotkey:camera.toggle-show-all-layers/> to toggle the <gl>Visibility</gl> of higher <gl>Floors</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKBasicControls.text-undoredo-1: You can <gl>Undo</gl> your actions with <hotkey:main.undo/> and <gl>Redo</gl> it with <hotkey:main.redo/>.
Entries.wiki.WKBasicControls.text-toolbar-shortc: Use the <gl>Toolbar Shortcuts</gl> to quickly select slots on the toolbar.
Entries.wiki.WKBasicControls.text-toolbar-prevne: You can also use <hotkey:toolbar.next-toolbar-slot/> and <hotkey:toolbar.previous-toolbar-slot/> to switch between slots.
Entries.wiki.WKBasicControls.text-toolbar-varian: Use <hotkey:toolbar.next-variant/> to switch between different <gl>Building Variants</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKBasicControls.text-toolbar-next-c: You can also press <hotkey:toolbar.next-toolbar/> to switch to the next category.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.title: Conveyor Belts & Lifts
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-placement-1: Select a belt and drag with <hotkey:building-placement.confirm-placement/> to place it.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-anchors-1: Place <gl>Anchors</gl> with <hotkey:building-placement.place-checkpoint/> to easily create belt paths with multiple turns in one go.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-splitters-1: Drag from existing belts to automatically <gl>Split</gl> them, and onto existing belts to <gl>Merge</gl> them.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-cross-floor-1: Once you have unlocked the second <gl>Floor</gl>, you can transport items between floors and even place buildings there.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-cross-floor-2: <gl>While Dragging</gl> a belt, press <hotkey:camera.select-layer-up/> to move one floor up and <hotkey:camera.select-layer-down/> to move one floor down. This will automatically place a <gl>Conveyor Lift</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-ideal-ratios-1: You need <gl>Multiples</gl> of a <gl>Building</gl> per <gl>Full Belt</gl>. You can see how many you need in the <gl>Details Panel</gl> while you have it selected (<gl>Buildings Per Full Belt</gl>) - it depends on your upgrade levels.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-flip-edge1: You can press <hotkey:building-placement.mirror/> to <gl>Flip</gl> the edge of the belt to the opposite corner, for more refined control.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-rotation-1: While dragging a belt, it will automatically adjust the rotation to match surrounding buildings. However, you can enforce a <gl>Manual Rotation</gl>, both for the start and end.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-rotation-2: Press <hotkey:building-placement.rotate-cw/> before the placement to set a <gl>Manual Starting Rotation</gl>, and during the placement to set a <gl>Manual End Rotation</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.title: Research
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.text-intro-1: Complete <gl>Research Goals</gl> by delivering the required <gl>Shapes</gl> to the <gl>Vortex</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.text-intro-2: You can open the Research Interface with or by using the buttons in the top left. You can also bind custom hotkeys for every tab in the settings.
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.text-milestones-1: <gl>Milestones</gl> are huge goals and, once completed, the <gl>Vortex</gl> will reward your efforts with entirely new technologies.
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.text-milestones-2: Try to focus on advancing the current milestone goals before starting new side tasks to avoid waiting times.
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.text-side-tasks-2: While you wait for the current milestone to complete, you can start <gl>Side Tasks</gl>. These are smaller goals that evolve in multiple steps; you will receive <gl>Research Points</gl> for every step completed.
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.text-task-pins: You can <gl>Pin</gl> a task to keep track of your progress.
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.text-shop-1: Once you've accumulated <gl>Research Points</gl>, visit the <gl>Upgrades</gl> tab to acquire upgrades and enhance your factory.
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.text-shop-2: Upgrades can be very powerful, so be sure to keep an eye out for new ones and choose wisely!
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.title: Scaling Up
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-intro: To keep up with the demands of the <gl>Vortex</gl>, expanding your factory is required. Successful operators have agreed on a set of best practices, and we convinced them to share them with you.
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-modularity-1: Try to group parts of your factory into <gl>Modules</gl> that can be reused and exchanged.
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-modularity-2: Reuse those modules utilizing <link:wiki.WKBlueprints>Blueprints</link> so you don't have to constantly build them from scratch.
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-platform-modules-1: If you think of platforms as buildings, you can apply the concepts you learned on a new scale.
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-platform-modules-2: Why not build a platform that takes 4 belts of shapes, rotates all of them and outputs them on the other side?
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-platform-modules-3: Voila - you now have your own <gl>Space Rotator Module</gl>!
Entries.wiki.WKCutting.title: Cutting Shapes
Entries.wiki.WKCutting.text-intro: The <gl>Quarters</gl> that make up a <gl>Shape</gl> can be separated and altered. Buildings of the <gl>Cutting</gl> type will assist you in isolating, separating or swapping quarters.
Entries.wiki.WKCutting.text-destroyer: The Half-Destroyer uses the isolator laser to disintegrate the West Half of a shape, outputting anything that remains.
Entries.wiki.WKCutting.text-cutter: Once unlocked, the Cutter utilizes a holographic blade to split a Shape in two, separating its West Half from the East Half and outputting both in parallel.
Entries.wiki.WKCutting.text-swapper: Once unlocked, the Swapper utilizes two holographic blades, allowing it to simultaneously split shapes and swap their West Halves, before outputting both.
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.title: Rotating Shapes
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.text-intro: With rotators you can change the <gl>Rotation</gl> of shapes.
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.text-rotator-1: The regular Rotator rotates your shape by 90 degrees clockwise, allowing for all four rotations to be achieved.
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.text-rotator-2: Additional variants can be unlocked for rotating counter-clockwise or by 180 degrees, enabling more elegant builds.
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.text-vortex: The Vortex accepts any shape rotation, so there is no need to rotate the shapes before.
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.text-building-rotation-1: While it does not matter for the vortex, the rotation of shapes when entering a <gl>Building</gl> affects how they are processed, as you will see in the examples below.
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.text-cutting: All Cutters separate the West Half of a shape. By rotating a Shape, you can control which half is cut. This allows you to cut, rotate and cut again to produce Quarters for example.
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.text-stacking: Shapes are <link:wiki.WKStacking>Stacked</link> as if they fell on top of each other. By rotating a shape, you can control which part falls where. This is what allows two halves to become a whole shape or end up on top of one another.
Entries.wiki.WKStacking.title: Stacking Shapes
Entries.wiki.WKStacking.text-intro: Shapes can be combined through <gl>Stacking</gl>, which enables the production of shapes with multiple <gl>Layers</gl> and/or to combine different <gl>Quarters</gl> into a single layer.
Entries.wiki.WKStacking.text-stacker-1: The <gl>Stacker</gl> receives shapes from two floors - as the upper shape is dropped on top of the lower, any disconnected sections will fall until they hit a solid surface.
Entries.wiki.WKStacking.text-stacker-2: If both shapes are whole, they'll end up on top of each other - for shapes full of empty or loose quarters, some parts can fall further before landing.
Entries.wiki.WKStacking.text-layer-limit-1: Shapes can have 4 Layers at most (5 on Insane difficulty). Attempting to stack more than 4 layers will cause the excess layers to be destroyed.
Entries.wiki.WKStacking.text-layer-limit-2: Without spoiling too much, you can use this for specific mechanics in the later stages of the game, so keep it in mind!
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.title: Blueprints
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-intro-1: <gl>Blueprints</gl> allow you to quickly copy and paste sections of your factories, avoiding repetitive work.
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-copypaste-1: Select an area with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> <hotkey:mass-selection.select-base/>, then press <hotkey:mass-selection.make-blueprint/> to copy it.
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-copypaste-2: Blueprints are copied as <gl>Blueprint Code</gl> to your system clipboard by default, so you can share them with others!
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-library-1: Any blueprint or selection can be saved to the <gl>Blueprint Library</gl> with <hotkey:building-placement.save-blueprint/>.
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-library-2: The library can be accessed with <hotkey:main.toggle-blueprint-library/> or its designated button at the top-right of the screen.
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-library-3: Saved blueprints can be edited with right click.
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-toolbar-1: Any blueprint can be placed in the <gl>Blueprint Toolbar</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-cost-1: Only in <gl>Challenge</gl> difficulty, blueprints cost <gl>Blueprint Points</gl>. You need to deliver specific shapes to generate <gl>Blueprint Points</gl> first.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.title: Space Platforms
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-intro-1: Unlocking <gl>Space Platforms</gl> allows you to expand your factories beyond the <gl>Vortex Platform</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-intro-2: Regular layouts serve as foundations for <gl>Buildings</gl>; unique layouts, like <gl>Miners</gl>, serve a unique purpose.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-chunk-limit-1: Placing platforms consumes your <gl>Platform Limit</gl>, which you can increase by completing <gl>Side Tasks</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-chunk-limit-2: The limit is refunded when the platform is deleted.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-platform-scope-1: Zoom out or press <hotkey:main.scope-change/> to switch between <gl>Building Mode</gl> and <gl>Platform Mode</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-belt-1: <gl>Space Belts</gl> can be placed just as regular belts but on platform scale. They transport up to 4 belts per floor, up to a maximum of 12.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-belt-2: Space belts have the same <gl>Throughput</gl> as conveyor belts, although items move much faster on them.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-belt-connection-1: Simply drag a belt towards or from a space belt to send and receive items.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-belt-tunnels: You can use <gl>Space Belt Tunnels</gl> to route belts below other platforms, belts or rails.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-miner-1: <gl>Miner Platforms</gl> can only be placed on top of <gl>Asteroids</gl> - once placed, the resource can be obtained by placing the appropriate extractors on the platform.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-miner-extension-1: You can chain up to 3 <gl>Miner Extensions</gl> to increase the throughput.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-layout: To create <link:wiki.WKExpanding>Platform Modules</link> or simply expand your buildable area, platforms serve as <gl>Foundations</gl> for your structures. Additional layouts are available as upgrades.
Entries.wiki.WKPinPusher.title: Pin Pusher
Entries.wiki.WKPinPusher.text-intro: Shape quarters that are not connected will fall when <link:wiki.WKStacking>Stacked</link>. However, with <gl>Support Pins</gl> you can build shapes that are impossible to build otherwise.
Entries.wiki.WKPinPusher.text-pusher-1: The Pin Pusher pushes a Support Pin under every non-empty Quarter on the first layer. These pins hold the quarters and can be stacked themselves.
Entries.wiki.WKPinPusher.text-pusher-2: Utilizing this technology, you can create shapes that would otherwise be impossible - with large gaps and sections elevated by multiple layers.
Entries.wiki.WKPinPusher.text-layer-limit-1: Attempting to push a shape over 4 layers (5 on Insane difficulty) will cause the excess layers to be destroyed.
Entries.wiki.WKPinPusher.text-layer-limit-2: You can use this to create shapes with pins on top.
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.title: Trains
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.text-intro: With <gl>Trains</gl> you can transport huge amounts of shapes and fluids over long distances.
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.text-rails-1: Trains can only go on <gl>Rails</gl>. Place them just like you would place regular belts or space belts.
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.text-rails-2: Once trains reach the end of a rail, they will go back on the <gl>Bottom Side</gl>, following the same path they took on the top side.
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.text-depots-1: Every train starts with a <gl>Locomotive</gl>. When placing it, you can select which color the train will have - more colors are available as upgrades.
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.text-depots-2: You can add as many <gl>Wagons</gl> as you'd like by placing additional wagons behind the locomotive, as long as they're all connected.
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.text-loading-1: To <gl>Load</gl> and <gl>Unload</gl> wagons, place a <gl>Train Stop</gl> to signal the locomotive to halt.
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.text-loading-2: To load wagons, place one or more <gl>Loaders</gl> next to a <gl>Train Stop</gl>, similarly to how you build locomotives & wagons.
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.text-loading-3: To unload wagons, do the same but with <gl>Unloaders</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.text-routing-1: Trains drive forward, unless otherwise specified. You can use <gl>Rail Routing</gl> to make different colored trains go into different directions.
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.text-routing-2: For example, you can make red trains skip a certain stop:
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.text-launchers-1: Just like belts, you can also launch trains to cross gaps using <gl>Train Launchers</gl>. You can adjust the range with the scroll wheel <hotkey:camera.angle-drag-modifier/>.
Entries.wiki.WKTrains.text-launchers-2: Trains can also be launched directly into the <gl>Vortex</gl> to deliver all of their contained shapes.
Entries.wiki.WKFluids.title: Fluids & Painting
Entries.wiki.WKFluids.text-intro: <gl>Color Fluids</gl> are required to paint shapes, introducing multiple new concepts.
Entries.wiki.WKFluids.text-fluid-miner-1: Use <gl>Fluid Miners</gl> to extract from <gl>Fluid Deposits</gl> on the map, similar to shape miners.
Entries.wiki.WKFluids.text-fluid-miner-2: You can unlock the <gl>Fluid Miner Extension</gl> to increase the throughput.
Entries.wiki.WKFluids.text-pumps-1: Place one or multiple <gl>Pumps</gl> on the Fluid Miner. Every pump extracts a fixed amount of liters per minute, which you can view by clicking the pump.
Entries.wiki.WKFluids.text-pipes-1: <gl>Pipes</gl> are required to transport fluids. They have a throughput limit of 9,000 liters per minute.
Entries.wiki.WKFluids.text-space-pipes-1: Use <gl>Space Pipes</gl> to transport fluid between platforms, as it can't go on regular space belts.
Entries.wiki.WKFluids.text-space-pipes-2: <gl>Space Pipe Tunnels</gl> are also available and work exactly as the space belt tunnels.
Entries.wiki.WKFluids.text-painter-1: Connect both fluid and shapes to a Painter to paint the shape. The painter always paints the Topmost layer of a given shape.
Entries.wiki.WKFluids.text-color-blind-1: If you have trouble distinguishing the colors below (every pipe contains a different color), you might be <gl>Colorblind</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKFluids.text-color-blind-2: You can switch the color scheme to RGB (Color blind) in the settings to be able to distinguish the colors.
Entries.wiki.WKMixing.title: Color Mixing
Entries.wiki.WKMixing.text-intro: By <gl>Mixing Colors</gl> you can create <gl>Secondary</gl> and <gl>Tertiary</gl> colors.
Entries.wiki.WKMixing.text-mixer-1: Use the <gl>Color Mixer</gl> and connect two <gl>Color Fluids</gl> to mix them.
Entries.wiki.WKMixing.text-mixer-2: The <gl>Fluid Volume</gl> is preserved, so if you mix 10 liters of red and 10 liters of green, you will get 20 liters of yellow.
Entries.wiki.WKMixing.text-mixing-scheme-1: By default, colors are mixed using <gl>Additive Color Mixing</gl>, similar to light.
Entries.wiki.WKMixing.text-mixing-scheme-2: If you prefer alternative schemes like RYB or CMYK, you can change the <gl>Color Mode</gl> in the settings any time.
Entries.wiki.WKCrystals.title: Crystals
Entries.wiki.WKCrystals.text-intro: <gl>Crystals</gl> are produced by hardening fluids and are designed by the vortex to challenge even the most experienced operators.
Entries.wiki.WKCrystals.text-crystal-generation: The <gl>Crystal Generator</gl> fills <gl>Gaps</gl> and <gl>Pins</gl> in a shape with the provided fluid, hardening the fluid to <gl>Crystal</gl> in the process.
Entries.wiki.WKCrystals.text-crystal-behaviour-1: Crystals are <gl>Fragile</gl>, and thus break when falling down, for example while <link:wiki.WKStacking>Stacked</link>.
Entries.wiki.WKCrystals.text-crystal-behaviour-2: <link:wiki.WKCutting>Cutting</link> through a crystal will <gl>Shatter</gl> it, destroying all connected crystals on the same, upper and lower shape layers.
Entries.wiki.WKCrystals.text-crystal-behaviour-3: While stacking crystals breaks them, you can use the <gl>Halves Swapper</gl> to swap halves, as long as you don't cut through them.
Entries.wiki.WKOperatorLevel.title: Operator Level
Entries.wiki.WKOperatorLevel.text-intro: Once unlocked, you can compete with other players using the <gl>Operator level</gl>.
Entries.wiki.WKOperatorLevel.text-levelling-1: Deliver eligible <gl>Past Milestone Shapes</gl> to increase your <gl>Operator Level</gl>. Increasing your operator level grants you rewards that allow you to grow your factory even more.
Entries.wiki.WKOperatorLevel.text-levelling-2: You can view your current level and required shapes in the <gl>Operator Research Tab</gl>. The level is also shown on the <gl>Compass</gl> in the lower right, and with every level gained your shape badge evolves.
Entries.wiki.WKOperatorLevel.text-competition-1: Once you are in the top 50%, your global rank is shown in the operator level tab.
Entries.tutorial.skip-tutorial-button.title: Mark Completed
Entries.tutorial.side-goal-before-milestone-warn: We recommend prioritizing the milestone shapes first, and doing the side tasks while they are being delivered!
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_JumpToHUB: Lost? Click the <gl>Home Icon</gl> or press <hotkey:waypoints.center-on-base/> to jump back to the <gl>Vortex Platform</gl>.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_ShapeViewer: Click any shape in the interface to open the <gl>Shape Viewer</gl>.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_Predictions: <gl>Shape Previews</gl> show you the result even before shapes arrive, allowing you to build faster.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_Mirroring: <gl>Mirror</gl> buildings, platforms and blueprints with <hotkey:building-placement.mirror/>. Use <hotkey:building-placement.mirror-inverse/> to mirror on the other axis.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_MultiLayerHubDel: You can deliver shapes from <gl>Multiple Floors</gl> to the <gl>Vortex</gl>. If that still is not sufficient, you can unlock more <gl>Vortex Inputs</gl>.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_Pipette: Move your cursor over a building or platform and press <hotkey:mass-selection.pipette/> to quickly select it in the toolbar.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_SaveBlueprintToL: Press <hotkey:building-placement.save-blueprint/> to <gl>Save</gl> a selection or blueprint to your <gl>Library</gl>, allowing you to quickly access it later.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_BindBlueprintToT: You can assign blueprints and blueprint folders to the <gl>Blueprint Toolbar</gl> for quick access.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_Visualizations: Toggle <gl>Visualizations</gl> while in <gl>Platform mode</gl> to customize your view.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_VortexIndicators:
The vortex indicates whether you deliver the correct shapes:

-<gl>Red Cross</gl>: Not required anymore.
-<gl>Green Checkmark</gl>: Correct, keep delivering.
-<gl>Gray Checkmark</gl>: You delivered enough.
-<gl>Lock</gl>: Correct, but future goal.
-<gl>Blueprint</gl>: Blueprint shape (challenge difficulty only).
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_SelectConnectedB: Press <hotkey:mass-selection.select-connected/> to <gl>Expand</gl> a selection to all <gl>Connected Structures</gl>.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_ClearSelectionCo: Press <hotkey:mass-selection.clear-selection-contents/> to <gl>Clear</gl> all shapes and fluids of a <gl>Selection</gl>.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_PasteBlueprint: Press <hotkey:mass-selection.paste-blueprint/> to re-select your most recent blueprint.
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_1_PlaceBelts: Use <gl>Belts</gl> to deliver the shapes to the <gl>Vortex</gl> on the right.
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_2_1_WaitDeliveryWi: Open the <gl>Knowledge Panel</gl> to review past instructions!
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_2_2_WaitDelivery: Your goal is always shown below. Deliver the requested circles.
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_3_HalfCutter: Place 3 Half Destroyers to cut shapes into halves. ( / 3).
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_3_HalfCutter_Skill: You need <gl>Multiple Buildings</gl> per belt, the <gl>Amount</gl> is shown <gl>Top Right</gl>.
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_4_2_DeliverHalfCir:
Deliver the half circles.

This is not an idle game - why not extract some <gl>Squares</gl> already?
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_4_3_DeliverHalfCir:
Well done!

Deliver the remaining half circles and squares.
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_5_DeliverQuarterCi: Cut, Rotate and Cut again to produce quarter circles!
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_5_CutRotateCut_Ski: Place a Rotator between half destroyers to produce Quarters.
Entries.tutorial.TSStacker_0_PlaceStacker: Let's combine circles and squares! Place 4 Stackers ( / 4).
Entries.tutorial.TSStacker_0_PlaceStacker_Skill: Stackers output to the side, so you need a Gap between.
Entries.tutorial.TSStacker_StackedWrongOrder_Ski: Oops! Connect the stackers in the right order, it matters which belt goes on the top and which on the bottom.
Entries.tutorial.TSStacker_1_ConnectStackers: Supply the stackers with circles and squares!
Entries.tutorial.TSStacker_2_DeliverStackerResul:
Well done!

Now deliver the stacked shapes to the vortex.
Entries.tutorial.TSStacker_3_OpenResearchSideTas:
<gl>Research Points</gl> are rewarded for completing <gl>Side Tasks</gl>.

Open the <gl>Tasks Overview</gl>.
Entries.tutorial.TSStacker_3_PinSideTask_Skill: <gl>Pin</gl> the tasks you want to work on, making them always visible.
Entries.tutorial.TSStacker_4_SpendResearchPoints: Use the points to unlock an <gl>Upgrade</gl>.
Entries.tutorial.TSStacker_4_OpenResearchShop_Sk: Open the <gl>Upgrades</gl> tab, where you can spend your research points.
Entries.tutorial.TSBlueprints_0_CreateBlueprint_: Select an <gl>Area</gl> with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> <hotkey:mass-selection.select-base/> and then press <hotkey:mass-selection.make-blueprint/> to <gl>Copy</gl> it.
Entries.tutorial.TSIslands_0_PlaceShapeMiner:
Place a <gl>Shape Miner</gl> to extract shapes.

You can also chain <gl>Extensions</gl> to increase the throughput.
Entries.tutorial.TSIslands_1_ConnectMinerSpaceBe: Use <gl>Space Belts</gl> to connect the miner to the vortex.
Entries.tutorial.TSIslands_EnterIslandMode_Skill: Zoom out with <hotkey:camera.angle-drag-modifier/> or press <hotkey:main.scope-change/> to enter <gl>Platform Mode</gl>.
Entries.tutorial.TSIslands_SpaceBelt_Skill: <gl>Space Belts</gl> work just like regular belts, except on a much larger scale.
Entries.tutorial.TSIslands_SpaceBeltTunnels_Skil: You can place <gl>Tunnels</gl> to route space belts below other platforms.
Entries.tutorial.TSIslands_ShapeMinerExtension_S: Connect up to 3 <gl>Shape Miner Extensions</gl> to the <gl>Shape Miner</gl> to activate all extraction spots.
Entries.tutorial.TSIslands_LowChunkLimit_Skill: Placing platforms costs <gl>Platform Units</gl> which can be gained from side tasks and are refunded on deletion.
Entries.tutorial.TSIslands_DeleteIslandUndoRedo_: You can <gl>Undo</gl> any operation with <hotkey:main.undo/> and <gl>Redo</gl> it with <hotkey:main.redo/>.
Entries.tutorial.TSTrains_1_PlaceTrainDepot: Place a <gl>Locomotive</gl> to setup your train.
Entries.tutorial.TSTrains_2_PlaceShapeWagon: Place one or multiple <gl>Wagons</gl> behind the locomotive.
Entries.tutorial.TSTrains_3_PlaceTrainLoaderAndS:
Now place a <gl>Train Stop</gl>, which is required to make the train halt.

Also, place at least one <gl>Train Shape Loader</gl> behind the stop.
Entries.tutorial.TSTrains_4_PlaceTrainUnloader: Great job! Now place another <gl>Train Stop</gl> including a <gl>Train Shape Unloader</gl> to unload the train.
Entries.tutorial.TSTrains_Routing_Skill: You can <gl>Route</gl> different train <gl>Colors</gl> in different directions.
Entries.tutorial.TSTrains_DepotsAndWagons_Skill: Place a <gl>Locomotive</gl> and then one or multiple <gl>Wagons</gl> to setup your train.
Entries.tutorial.TSTrains_StopsAndLoaders_Skill: Place a <gl>Train Stop</gl> and then one or multiple <gl>Loaders</gl> or <gl>Unloaders</gl> to exchange items with the train.
Entries.tutorial.TSTrains_Launchers_Skill: You can launch trains with Launchers to cross other platforms. Use the scroll wheel to adjust the distance.
Entries.tutorial.TSFluids_0_PlaceFluidMiner: Place a <gl>Fluid Miner</gl> to extract fluids.
Entries.tutorial.TSFluids_2_PlacePipe: Connect the pump with a <gl>Pipe</gl> to the output of the platform.
Entries.tutorial.TSFluids_3_PlaceSpacePipe: Use a <gl>Space Pipe</gl> to transport the fluids to the platform where you want to paint the shapes.
Entries.tutorial.TSFluids_4_Painter: Place a <gl>Painter</gl> and paint your first shape!
Entries.tutorial.TSFluids_FluidMinerExtension_Sk: Connect up to 3 <gl>Fluid Miner Extensions</gl> to the fluid miner to activate all extraction spots.
Entries.tutorial.TSFluids_SpacePipe_Skill: <gl>Space Pipes</gl> can transport fluids in high amounts.
